metadata.title: USN-5479-1 -- PHP vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Charles Fol discovered that PHP incorrectly handled initializing certain arrays when handling the pg_query_params function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-31625)  Charles Fol discovered that PHP incorrectly handled passwords in mysqlnd. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-31626)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5479-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  php7.4-gd - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-readline - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-dba - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-common - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-xmlrpc - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-intl - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-phpdbg - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-ldap - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-sybase - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-xsl - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-pgsql - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-pspell - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-zip - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-curl - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-odbc - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-json - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-mbstring - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-imap - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-cgi - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-dev - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-interbase - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-tidy - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-gmp - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-sqlite3 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-enchant - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-fpm - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-soap - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-cli - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-mysql - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-snmp - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-xml - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 php7.4-opcache - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.12 No subscription required
